section.p: A problem is a clinical statement that a clinician is particularly concerned about and wants to track. It has important patient management use cases (e.g. health records often present the problem list as a way of summarizing a patient's medical history).

ol.li:
MAY contain [0..1] entryRelationship, such that it
contains Episode Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.41)
SHALL satisfy: Contains one or more entryRelationship

CONF-152: MAY satisfy: A problem act MAY reference a problem observation, alert observation (see section Alerts) or other clinical statement that is the subject of concern, by setting the value for "Act / entryRelationship / @typeCode" to be "SUBJ" 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1002 ActRelationshipType STATIC.

CONF-153: SHOULD satisfy: The target of a problem act with Act / entryRelationship / @typeCode="SUBJ" SHOULD be a problem observation (in the Problem section) or alert observation (in the Alert section), but MAY be some other clinical statement.
SHOULD satisfy: In Problem Section, a Problem Act SHOULD contain a Problem Observation.
SHOULD satisfy: In Alert Section, a ProblemAct SHOULD contain an Alert Observation.
MAY satisfy: Contains exactly one Patient Awareness
